alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 6:11AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 AM MDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buffalo, Saddlestring, Buffalo Johnson County Airport and Johnson County Fairgrounds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
